modules.description: This module provides a handler for rendering templates using the Minima theme, with functions to manipulate HTML elements and text within a Soup DOM. It works with string templates, Soup nodes, and URI values. Concrete use cases include generating static HTML pages from templates and modifying DOM elements during site generation.

This module generates HTML layouts for Minima pages, providing functions to construct complete HTML documents and common page structures. It operates on HTML nodes using the Soup library, incorporating metadata like titles, descriptions, and URIs for styling and navigation. Concrete use cases include rendering blog homepages with post listings, individual article pages with dates, and full HTML documents with headers, footers, and metadata.

This module generates HTML fragments for headers, footers, and icons used in static site layouts. It works with strings, URIs, and theme configurations to produce structured HTML nodes. Concrete use cases include rendering page headers with navigation links, generating document `<head>` elements with metadata, and creating social media icons for footers.
